brief_summary.textblock:
To study the effects of an 8-week combined inspiratory muscle training and exercise
      (resistance+aerobic) program on of a lung volume, inspiratory muscle strength (maximal
      inspiratory pressure, PImax) and cardiorespiratory fitness (maximal oxygen uptake, VO2peak)
      (primary outcomes)and dynamic muscle strength, body composition and quality of life (QoL) in
      children with Cystic Fibrosis   (CF) (secondary outcomes).

clinical_study.brief_title: Combined Inspiratory Muscle and 'Whole Muscle' Training in Children With Cystic Fibrosis

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators hypothesized that the combined training program would significantly
      benefit most of the aforementioned variables (especially, primary outcomes).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  boy/girl aged 6-17 years

          -  living in the Madrid area

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  severe lung deterioration [forced expiratory volume (FEV1) <50% of expected]

          -  unstable clinical condition (hospitalization within the previous 3 months)

          -  Burkholderia cepacia infection

          -  any disorder (e.g. muscle-skeletal) impairing exercise.

intervention.description: inspiratory muscle training (IMT) + aerobic and strength training 8-week duration IMT twice a day (mostly at home) + 3 weekly sessions of inhospital resistance + aerobic training

other_outcome.description: an indicator of the strength of inspiratory muscles

primary_outcome.description: maximum oxygen uptake (VO2peak), which is the best indicator of aerobic fitness in humans and an independent mortality predictor in children with cystic fibrosis
primary_outcome.time_frame: this outcome will be assessed up to 12 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: children's QoL with the Spanish Version (1.0) of the Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: this outcome will be assessed up to 12 weeks

collaborator.agency: Hospital Infantil Universitario Niño Jesús, Madrid, Spain

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor)
